citing_paper_authors: Maosong, Sun | Dayang, Shen | Benjamin K., T'sou
raw_text: Palmer (1997) conducted a Chinesesegrnenter which merely made use of a manually segmented corpus (without referring to any lexicon)
clean_text: Palmer (1997) conducted a Chinese segmenter which merely made use of a manually segmented corpus (without referring to any lexicon).

raw_text: In general, the word segmentation program utilizes the word entries, part-of-speech (POS) information (Chen and Liu, 1992) in a monolingual dictionary, segmentation rules (Palmer, 1997), and some statistical information (Sproat, et al, 1994)
clean_text: In general, the word segmentation program utilizes the word entries, part-of-speech (POS) information (Chen and Liu, 1992) in a monolingual dictionary, segmentation rules (Palmer, 1997), and some statistical information (Sproat, et al, 1994).

raw_text: However, it ' s not possible to list morphological rules for all kinds of unknown words, especially those words with very irregular structures, which have the characteristics of variable lengths and flexible morphological structures, such as proper names, abbreviations etc. Therefore, statistical approaches usually play major roles on irregular unknown word extraction in most previous work (Sproat& amp; Shih 1990, Chiang et. al 1992, Tung and Lee 1995, Palmer 1997, Chang et. al 1997, Sun et. al 1998, Ge et. al 1999)

This approach was used by Palmer (1997) for word segmentation. Hwa (1999) describes a somewhat similar approach for nding parse brackets which combines a fully annotated related training dataset and a large but incompletely annotated nal training data set
clean_text: This approach was used by Palmer (1997) for word segmentation.

raw_text: Our work adds an existing system to improve the rules learned, while Palmer (1997) adds rules to improve an existing system ' s performance
clean_text: Our work adds an existing system to improve the rules learned, while Palmer (1997) adds rules to improve an existing system's performance.

raw_text: One may note that the error reductions here are smaller than Palmer (1997) ' s error reductions
clean_text: One may note that the error reductions here are smaller than Palmer (1997)'s error reductions.

raw_text: In Palmer (1997), the baseline is how well an existing system performs before the rules are run
clean_text: In Palmer (1997), the baseline is how well an existing system performs before the rules are run.

raw_text: If we were to use the same baseline as Palmer (1997), our baseline would be an F of 37.5% for IaB and 52.6% for IaC
clean_text: If we were to use the same baseline as Palmer (1997), our baseline would be an F of 37.5% for IaB and 52.6% for IaC.

citing_paper_authors: Jia, Xu | Richard, Zens | Hermann, Ney
raw_text: For example, (Palmer, 1997) developed a Chinese word segmenter using a manually segmented corpus
clean_text: For example, (Palmer, 1997) developed a Chinese word segmenter using a manually segmented corpus.

raw_text: Palmer (1997) uses transform-based learning (TBL) to correct an initial segmentation
clean_text: Palmer (1997) uses transform-based learning (TBL) to correct an initial segmentation.

raw_text: In a later paper, Palmer (1997) presents a transformation-based algorithm, which requires pre-segmented training data
clean_text: In a later paper, Palmer (1997) presents a transformation-based algorithm, which requires pre-segmented training data.

citing_paper_authors: Jianfeng, Gao | Andi, Wu | Changning, Huang | Hongqiao, Li | Xinsong, Xia | Hauwei, Qin
raw_text: The use of TBL for Chinese word segmentation was first suggested in Palmer (1997)
